Key Match Events: Max Schuemann and Lawrence Butler each hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning to propel the Oakland Athletics past the Cincinnati Reds 5-4.
Zack Gelof added a solo shot in the eighth inning.
All-Star closer Mason Miller hung on after giving up two runs and four hits in a shaky ninth inning, securing his 22nd save.
Jakob Junis made his fourth start of the season for the Reds and retired all 12 batters he faced with three strikeouts.
Post-Match Reflections: A's manager Mark Kotsay expressed satisfaction with the come-from-behind win, stating, 'When we’ve been behind where we haven’t scored first, we haven’t been very successful this season. It’s nice that we got a come-from-behind win tonight and finished it off.'

Reds manager David Bell praised Jakob Junis's performance, saying, 'Jakob just threw a ton of strikes. We didn’t know how far he could go. To be able to get those four innings set us up to give us a chance to win.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oakland had one hit and trailed 1-0 through six innings but rallied to hand Cincinnati its ninth straight loss against interleague opponents.
Oakland has 162 home runs this season, tied with the Minnesota Twins for seventh in the majors. More than 50% of the runs for the A's this season have come on homers.
Others: Athletics: C Tyler Soderstrom (left wrist bone bruise) has started hitting and could begin a rehab assignment this week.

Reds: LHP Nick Lodolo (left middle finger strain) was placed on the 15-day injured list, retroactive to Aug. 24. LHP Brandon Williamson (shoulder strain) was sent to Triple-A Louisville on a rehab assignment. OF Stuart Fairchild (left thumb sprain) was placed on the 10-day IL.
Osvaldo Bido (5-3, 3.24 ERA) pitches Wednesday for Oakland. The Reds had not announced a scheduled starter. Bido is 3-0 with a 0.53 ERA in his last three starts.
